segment.source: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)
segment.target: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)

segment.source: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)
segment.target: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)

segment.source: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)
segment.target: Windows Recovery Environment (Windows RE)

segment.source: Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) is a recovery environment that can repair common causes of unbootable operating systems.
segment.target: Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) is a recovery environment that can repair common causes of unbootable operating systems.

segment.source: WinRE is based on Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), and can be customized with additional drivers, languages, Windows PE Optional Components, and other troubleshooting and diagnostic tools.
segment.target: WinRE is based on Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), and can be customized with additional drivers, languages, Windows PE Optional Components, and other troubleshooting and diagnostic tools.

segment.source: By default, WinRE is preloaded into the Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) and Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview installations.
segment.target: By default, WinRE is preloaded into the Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) and Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview installations.

segment.source: What's new with WinRE for Windows 10?
segment.target: What's new with WinRE for Windows 10?

segment.source: By default, if you install Windows using media created from Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), you'll get a dedicated WinRE tools partition on both UEFI and BIOS-based devices, located immediately after the Windows partition.
segment.target: By default, if you install Windows using media created from Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), you'll get a dedicated WinRE tools partition on both UEFI and BIOS-based devices, located immediately after the Windows partition.

segment.source: This allows Windows to replace and resize the partition as needed.
segment.target: This allows Windows to replace and resize the partition as needed.

segment.source: (If you install Windows by using Windows Setup, you'll get the same partition layout that you did in Windows 8.1.)
segment.target: (If you install Windows by using Windows Setup, you'll get the same partition layout that you did in Windows 8.1.)

segment.source: If you add a custom tool to the WinRE boot options menu, it can only use optional components that are already in the default WinRE tools.
segment.target: If you add a custom tool to the WinRE boot options menu, it can only use optional components that are already in the default WinRE tools.

segment.source: For example, if you have a app from Windows 8 that depended on the .NET optional components, you'll need to rewrite the app for Windows 10.
segment.target: For example, if you have a app from Windows 8 that depended on the .NET optional components, you'll need to rewrite the app for Windows 10.

segment.source: If you add a custom tool to the WinRE boot options menu, it must be placed in the SourcesRecoveryTools folder so that it can continue to work after future WinRE upgrades.
segment.target: If you add a custom tool to the WinRE boot options menu, it must be placed in the SourcesRecoveryTools folder so that it can continue to work after future WinRE upgrades.

segment.source: When adding languages to the push-button reset tools, you'll now need to add the WinPE-HTA optional component.
segment.target: When adding languages to the push-button reset tools, you'll now need to add the WinPE-HTA optional component.

segment.source: Tools
segment.target: Tools

segment.source: WinRE includes these tools:
segment.target: WinRE includes these tools:

segment.source: Automatic repair and other troubleshooting tools.
segment.target: Automatic repair and other troubleshooting tools.

segment.source: For more info, see Windows RE Troubleshooting Features.
segment.target: For more info, see Windows RE Troubleshooting Features.

segment.source: Push-button reset (Windows 10 for desktop editions , Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 only).
segment.target: Push-button reset (Windows 10 for desktop editions , Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 only).

segment.source: This tool enables your users to repair their own PCs quickly while preserving their data and important customizations, without having to back up data in advance.
segment.target: This tool enables your users to repair their own PCs quickly while preserving their data and important customizations, without having to back up data in advance.

segment.source: For more info, see Push-Button Reset Overview.
segment.target: For more info, see Push-Button Reset Overview.

segment.source: System image recovery (Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows Server 2012 only).
segment.target: System image recovery (Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview, Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows Server 2012 only).

segment.source: This tool restores the entire hard drive.
segment.target: This tool restores the entire hard drive.

segment.source: For more info, see Recover the Operating System or Full Server.
segment.target: For more info, see Recover the Operating System or Full Server.

segment.source: In addition, you can create your own custom recovery solution by using the Windows Imaging API, or by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) API.
segment.target: In addition, you can create your own custom recovery solution by using the Windows Imaging API, or by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) API.

segment.source: Entry points into WinRE
segment.target: Entry points into WinRE

segment.source: Your users can access WinRE features through the Boot Options menu, which can be launched from Windows in a few different ways:
segment.target: Your users can access WinRE features through the Boot Options menu, which can be launched from Windows in a few different ways:

segment.source: In Windows 10, select StartSettingsUpdate & recoveryRecovery under Advanced Startup, click Restart now.
segment.target: In Windows 10, select StartSettingsUpdate & recoveryRecovery under Advanced Startup, click Restart now.

segment.source: Boot to recovery media.
segment.target: Boot to recovery media.

segment.source: You can configure a hardware recovery button (or button combination) to run a secondary boot path that includes WinRE.
segment.target: You can configure a hardware recovery button (or button combination) to run a secondary boot path that includes WinRE.

segment.source: For more information, see Add a Hardware Recovery Button to Start Windows RE.
segment.target: For more information, see Add a Hardware Recovery Button to Start Windows RE.

segment.source: After any of these actions is performed, all user sessions are signed off and the Boot Options menu is displayed.
segment.target: After any of these actions is performed, all user sessions are signed off and the Boot Options menu is displayed.

segment.source: If your users select a WinRE feature from this menu, the PC restarts into WinRE and the selected feature is launched.
segment.target: If your users select a WinRE feature from this menu, the PC restarts into WinRE and the selected feature is launched.

segment.source: WinRE starts automatically after detecting the following issues:
segment.target: WinRE starts automatically after detecting the following issues:

segment.source: Two consecutive failed attempts to start Windows.
segment.target: Two consecutive failed attempts to start Windows.

segment.source: Two consecutive unexpected shutdowns that occur within two minutes of boot completion.
segment.target: Two consecutive unexpected shutdowns that occur within two minutes of boot completion.

segment.source: A Secure Boot error (except for issues related to Bootmgr.efi).
segment.target: A Secure Boot error (except for issues related to Bootmgr.efi).

segment.source: A BitLocker error on touch-only devices.
segment.target: A BitLocker error on touch-only devices.

segment.source: Boot options menu
segment.target: Boot options menu

segment.source: This menu enables your users to perform these actions:
segment.target: This menu enables your users to perform these actions:

segment.source: Start recovery, troubleshooting, and diagnostic tools.
segment.target: Start recovery, troubleshooting, and diagnostic tools.

segment.source: Boot from a device (UEFI only).
segment.target: Boot from a device (UEFI only).

segment.source: Access the Firmware menu (UEFI only).
segment.target: Access the Firmware menu (UEFI only).

segment.source: Choose which operating system to boot, if multiple operating systems are installed on the PC.
segment.target: Choose which operating system to boot, if multiple operating systems are installed on the PC.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can add one custom tool to the Boot options menu.
segment.target: You can add one custom tool to the Boot options menu.

segment.source: Otherwise, these menus can't be further customized.
segment.target: Otherwise, these menus can't be further customized.

segment.source: For more info, see Add a Custom Tool to the Windows RE Boot Options Menu.
segment.target: For more info, see Add a Custom Tool to the Windows RE Boot Options Menu.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: When working with WinRE, be aware of these security considerations:
segment.target: When working with WinRE, be aware of these security considerations:

segment.source: If users open the Boot options menu from Windows and select a WinRE tool, they must provide the user name and password of a local user account with administrator rights.
segment.target: If users open the Boot options menu from Windows and select a WinRE tool, they must provide the user name and password of a local user account with administrator rights.

segment.source: By default, networking is disabled in WinRE.
segment.target: By default, networking is disabled in WinRE.

segment.source: You can turn on networking when you need it.
segment.target: You can turn on networking when you need it.

segment.source: However, we recommend that you disable networking when you don't need connectivity.
segment.target: However, we recommend that you disable networking when you don't need connectivity.

segment.source: Customizing WinRE
segment.target: Customizing WinRE

segment.source: You can customize WinRE by adding packages (Windows PE Optional Components), languages, drivers, and custom diagnostic or troubleshooting tools.
segment.target: You can customize WinRE by adding packages (Windows PE Optional Components), languages, drivers, and custom diagnostic or troubleshooting tools.

segment.source: The base WinRE image includes these Windows PE Optional Components:
segment.target: The base WinRE image includes these Windows PE Optional Components:

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Foundation-Package
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Foundation-Package

segment.source: WinPE-EnhancedStorage
segment.target: WinPE-EnhancedStorage

segment.source: WinPE-Rejuv
segment.target: WinPE-Rejuv

segment.source: WinPE-Scripting
segment.target: WinPE-Scripting

segment.source: WinPE-SecureStartup
segment.target: WinPE-SecureStartup

segment.source: WinPE-Setup
segment.target: WinPE-Setup

segment.source: WinPE-SRT
segment.target: WinPE-SRT

segment.source: WinPE-WDS-Tools
segment.target: WinPE-WDS-Tools

segment.source: WinPE-WMI
segment.target: WinPE-WMI

segment.source: WinPE-StorageWMI-Package (added to the base image in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2)
segment.target: WinPE-StorageWMI-Package (added to the base image in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2)

segment.source: WinPE-HTA (added to the base image in Windows 10)
segment.target: WinPE-HTA (added to the base image in Windows 10)

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The number of packages, languages, and drivers is limited by the amount of memory available on the PC.
segment.target: The number of packages, languages, and drivers is limited by the amount of memory available on the PC.

segment.source: For performance reasons, we recommend that you minimize the number of languages, drivers, and tools that you add to the image.
segment.target: For performance reasons, we recommend that you minimize the number of languages, drivers, and tools that you add to the image.

segment.source: Hard drive partitions
segment.target: Hard drive partitions

segment.source: When you install Windows by using Windows Setup, WinRE is configured like this:
segment.target: When you install Windows by using Windows Setup, WinRE is configured like this:

segment.source: During Windows Setup, Windows prepares the hard drive partitions to support WinRE.
segment.target: During Windows Setup, Windows prepares the hard drive partitions to support WinRE.

segment.source: Windows initially places the WinRE image file (winre.wim) in the Windows partition, in the WindowsSystem32Recovery folder.
segment.target: Windows initially places the WinRE image file (winre.wim) in the Windows partition, in the WindowsSystem32Recovery folder.

segment.source: Before delivering the PC to your customer, you can modify or replace the WinRE image file to include additional languages, drivers, or packages.
segment.target: Before delivering the PC to your customer, you can modify or replace the WinRE image file to include additional languages, drivers, or packages.

segment.source: During the specialize configuration pass, the WinRE image file is copied into the recovery tools partition, so that the device can boot to the recovery tools even if there's a problem with the Windows partition.
segment.target: During the specialize configuration pass, the WinRE image file is copied into the recovery tools partition, so that the device can boot to the recovery tools even if there's a problem with the Windows partition.

segment.source: When you deploy Windows by applying images, you must manually configure the hard drive partitions.
segment.target: When you deploy Windows by applying images, you must manually configure the hard drive partitions.

segment.source: When WinRE is installed on a hard drive, the partition must be formatted as NTFS.
segment.target: When WinRE is installed on a hard drive, the partition must be formatted as NTFS.

segment.source: Add the baseline WinRE tools image (winre.wim) to a separate partition from the Windows and data partitions.
segment.target: Add the baseline WinRE tools image (winre.wim) to a separate partition from the Windows and data partitions.

segment.source: This enables your users to use WinRE even if the Windows partition is encrypted with Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: This enables your users to use WinRE even if the Windows partition is encrypted with Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: It also prevents your users from accidentally modifying or removing the WinRE tools.
segment.target: It also prevents your users from accidentally modifying or removing the WinRE tools.

segment.source: We recommend that you store the recovery tools in a dedicated partition, directly after the Windows partition.
segment.target: We recommend that you store the recovery tools in a dedicated partition, directly after the Windows partition.

segment.source: For more info about configuring hard drive partitions, see Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Drive Partitions or Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Drive Partitions.
segment.target: For more info about configuring hard drive partitions, see Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Drive Partitions or Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Drive Partitions.

segment.source: Memory requirements
segment.target: Memory requirements

segment.source: In order to boot Windows RE directly from memory (also known as RAM disk boot), a contiguous portion of physical memory (RAM) which can hold the entire Windows RE image (winre.wim) must be available.
segment.target: In order to boot Windows RE directly from memory (also known as RAM disk boot), a contiguous portion of physical memory (RAM) which can hold the entire Windows RE image (winre.wim) must be available.

segment.source: To optimize memory use, manufacturers should ensure that their firmware reserves memory locations either at the beginning or at the end of the physical memory address space.
segment.target: To optimize memory use, manufacturers should ensure that their firmware reserves memory locations either at the beginning or at the end of the physical memory address space.
